property.name: fs.gs.project.id
property.description: Required. Google Cloud Project ID with access to configured GCS buckets.

property.name: fs.gs.working.dir
property.description: The directory relative gs: uris resolve in inside of the default bucket.

property.name: fs.gs.metadata.cache.enable
property.description: Whether or not to create an in memory cache of GCS objects created by the connector. This allows for immediate visibility of objects to subsequent list requests from the same client.

property.name: fs.gs.implicit.directory.repair
property.description: Whether or not to create objects for the parent directories of objects with / in their path e.g. creating gs://bucket/foo/ upon finding gs://bucket/foo/bar.

property.name: fs.gs.glob.flatlist.enable
property.description: Whether or not to prepopulate potenital glob matches in a single list request to minimize calls to GCS in nested glob cases.

property.name: fs.gs.system.bucket
property.description: Deprecated. GCS bucket to use as a default bucket if fs.default.name is not a gs: uri.

property.name: google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable
property.description: Whether to use a service account for GCS authorizaiton. If an email and keyfile are provided (see google.cloud.auth.service.account.email and google.cloud.auth.service.account.keyfile), then that service account willl be used. Otherwise the connector will look to see if it running on a GCE VM with some level of GCS access in it's service account scope, and use that service account.

property.name: google.cloud.auth.service.account.email
property.description: The email address is associated with the service account used for GCS access when google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable is true.

property.name: google.cloud.auth.service.account.keyfile
property.description: The PKCS12 (p12) certificate file of the service account used for GCS access when google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable is true.

property.name: google.cloud.auth.client.id
property.description: The client ID for GCS access in the OAuth 2.0 installed application flow (when google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable is false).

property.name: google.cloud.auth.client.secret
property.description: The client secret for GCS access in the OAuth 2.0 installed application flow (when google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable is false).

property.name: google.cloud.auth.client.file
property.description: The client credential file for GCS access in the OAuth 2.0 installed application flow (when google.cloud.auth.service.account.enable is false).

property.name: fs.gs.block.size
property.description: The reported block size of the file system. This does not change any behavior of the connector or the underlying GCS objectsr. However it will affect the number of splits Hadoop MapReduce uses for a given input.

property.name: fs.gs.io.buffersize
property.description: The number of bytes in read buffers.

property.name: fs.gs.io.buffersize.write
property.description: The number of bytes in write buffers.

property.name: fs.gs.file.size.limit.250gb
property.description: Whether to limit files to 250 GB. Setting to false may degrade connector performance somewhat.
